content.text: CSS Grid Container
Try it Yourself »
content.html: Try it Yourself »

content.text: Grid Container
A grid container contains one or more grid items arranged in columns and rows.
content.html: A grid container contains one or more grid items arranged in columns and rows.

content.text: Direct child elements(s) of the grid container automatically becomes grid items.
content.html: Direct child elements(s) of the grid container automatically becomes grid items.

content.text: An element becomes a grid container when its display property is set to grid or inline-grid .
content.html: An element becomes a grid container when its display property is set to grid or inline-grid.

content.text: Grid Tracks
The rows and columns of a grid is defined with the grid-template-rows and the grid-template-columns properties (or the shorthand grid or grid-template properties).
content.html: The rows and columns of a grid is defined with the grid-template-rows and the grid-template-columns properties (or the shorthand grid or grid-template properties).

content.text: These define the grid tracks. A grid track is the space between two adjacent grid lines.
content.html: These define the grid tracks. A grid track is the space between two adjacent grid lines.

content.text: The grid-template-columns Property
The grid-template-columns property defines the number of columns in your grid layout, and it can define the width of each column.
content.html: The grid-template-columns property defines the number of columns in your grid layout, and it can define the width of each column.

content.text: The value is a space-separated-list, where each value defines the width of the respective column.
content.html: The value is a space-separated-list, where each value defines the width of the respective column.

content.text: If you want your grid layout to contain 4 columns, specify the width of the 4 columns, or "auto" if all columns should have the same width.
content.html: If you want your grid layout to contain 4 columns, specify the width of the 4 columns, or "auto" if all columns should have the same width.

syntaxHighlighting.text:
display: grid;  
  grid-template-columns: auto auto auto auto;

syntax_highlighting.text:
display: grid;  
  grid-template-columns: auto auto auto auto;

content.code_html:
.grid-container {
  display: grid;
  grid-template-columns: auto auto auto auto;
}

syntax_highlighting_data.text:
display: grid;  
  grid-template-columns: auto auto auto auto;

content.text: The grid-template-columns property can also be used to specify the exact size (width) of the columns, or a mix of fixed size and auto.
content.html: The grid-template-columns property can also be used to specify the exact size (width) of the columns, or a mix of fixed size and auto.

content.code_html:
.grid-container {
  display: grid;
  grid-template-columns: 80px 200px auto 40px;
}

content.text: Note: If you have more than 4 grid items in a 4 columns grid, the grid will automatically add a new row to put the items in.
content.html: Note: If you have more than 4 grid items in a 4 columns grid, the grid will automatically add a new row to put the items in.

content.text: Cell Sizing with the fr Unit
The fr unit can be used when defining grids, like any other CSS length such as %, px or em.
content.html: The fr unit can be used when defining grids, like any other CSS length such as %, px or em.

content.text: The fr unit stands for "fraction". This unit automatically divides the available space into fractions.
content.html: The fr unit stands for "fraction". This unit automatically divides the available space into fractions.

content.text: Example: 1fr will take 1 fraction of the available space, while 2fr will take 2 fractions of the available space.
content.html: Example: 1fr will take 1 fraction of the available space, while 2fr will take 2 fractions of the available space.

content.code_html:
.grid-container {
  display: grid;
  grid-template-columns: 1fr 1fr 1fr 1fr;
}

.grid-container {
  display: grid;
  grid-template-columns: 1fr 2fr 1fr 1fr;
}

content.text: The grid-template-rows Property
The grid-template-rows property defines the height of each row.
content.html: The grid-template-rows property defines the height of each row.

content.text: The value is a space-separated-list, where each value defines the height of the respective row:
content.html: The value is a space-separated-list, where each value defines the height of the respective row:

content.code_html:
.grid-container {
  display: grid;
  grid-template-rows: 80px 200px;
}

content.text: Notice that the first row in the grid above is 80px high and the second row is 200px high. The next rows will use auto as default.
content.html: Notice that the first row in the grid above is 80px high and the second row is 200px high. The next rows will use auto as default.

content.text: The justify-content Property
The justify-content property is used to align the grid items when they do not use all available space on the main-axis (horizontally).
content.html: The justify-content property is used to align the grid items when they do not use all available space on the main-axis (horizontally).

content.text: The justify-content property can have one of the following values:
content.html: The justify-content property can have one of the following values:

content.text: Note: The grid item's total width has to be less than the container's width for the justify-content property to have any effect.
content.html: Note: The grid item's total width has to be less than the container's width for the justify-content property to have any effect.

content.code_html:
.grid-container {
  display: grid;
  justify-content: space-evenly;
}

.grid-container {
  display: grid;
  justify-content: space-around;
}

.grid-container {
  display: grid;
  justify-content: space-between;
}

.grid-container {
  display: grid;
  justify-content: center;
}

.grid-container {
  display: grid;
  justify-content: start;
}

.grid-container {
  display: grid;
  justify-content: end;
}

content.text: The align-content Property
The align-content property is used to align the grid items when they do not use all available space on the cross-axis (vertically).
content.html: The align-content property is used to align the grid items when they do not use all available space on the cross-axis (vertically).

content.text: The align-content property can have one of the following values:
content.html: The align-content property can have one of the following values:

content.text: Note: The grid item's total height has to be less than the container's height for the align-content property to have any effect.
content.html: Note: The grid item's total height has to be less than the container's height for the align-content property to have any effect.

content.text: In the following examples we use a 400 pixels high container, to better demonstrate the align-content property.
content.html: In the following examples we use a 400 pixels high container, to better demonstrate the align-content property.

content.code_html:
.grid-container {
  display: grid;
  height: 400px;
  align-content: center;
}

.grid-container {
  display: grid;
  height: 400px;
  align-content: space-evenly;
}

.grid-container {
  display: grid;
  height: 400px;
  align-content: space-around;
}

.grid-container {
  display: grid;
  height: 400px;
  align-content: space-between;
}

.grid-container {
  display: grid;
  height: 400px;
  align-content: start;
}

.grid-container {
  display: grid;
  height: 400px;
  align-content: end;
}

content.text: The place-content Property
The place-content property is a shorthand property for the align-content and the justify-content properties.
content.html: The place-content property is a shorthand property for the align-content and the justify-content properties.

content.text: If the place-content property has two values:
content.html: If the place-content property has two values:

content.text: If the place-content property has one value:
content.html: If the place-content property has one value:

content.text: Note: The grid item's total height and width has to be less than the container's height and width for the place-content property to have any effect.
content.html: Note: The grid item's total height and width has to be less than the container's height and width for the place-content property to have any effect.

content.code_html:
.grid-container {
  display: grid;
  height: 400px;
  place-content: center;
}

syntaxHighlighting.text:
display: grid;  height: 400px;  
  place-content: end space-between;

syntax_highlighting.text:
display: grid;  height: 400px;  
  place-content: end space-between;

content.code_html:
.grid-container {
  display: grid;
  height: 400px;
  place-content: end space-between;
}

syntax_highlighting_data.text:
display: grid;  height: 400px;  
  place-content: end space-between;

content.text: CSS Grid Container Properties

content.code_html:
Property Description
align-content Vertically aligns the whole grid inside the container (when total grid size is smaller than container)
align-items Aligns content in a grid item along the column axis
display Specifies the display behavior (the type of rendering box) of an element
column-gap Specifies the gap between the columns
gap A shorthand property for the row-gap and the column-gap properties
grid A shorthand property for the grid-template-rows, grid-template-columns, grid-template-areas, grid-auto-rows, grid-auto-columns, and the grid-auto-flow properties
grid-auto-columns Specifies a default column size
grid-auto-flow Specifies how auto-placed items are inserted in the grid
grid-auto-rows Specifies a default row size
grid-template A shorthand property for the grid-template-rows, grid-template-columns and grid-areas properties
grid-template-areas Specifies how to display columns and rows, using named grid items
grid-template-columns Specifies the size of the columns, and how many columns in a grid layout
grid-template-rows Specifies the size of the rows in a grid layout
justify-content Horizontally aligns the whole grid inside the container (when total grid size is smaller than container)
place-content A shorthand property for the align-content and the justify-content properties
row-gap Specifies the gap between the grid rows
